description:
The protagonist, Baki Hanma, trains with an intense focus to become strong enough to surpass his father, Yujiro Hanma, the strongest fighter in the world. Five of the world's most violent and brutal death row inmates are gathering to face Baki. Their objective is to taste defeat -- their unmatched strength and skill have led them to grow bored of life itself, and they now seek out Baki in the hopes that he can overwhelm and utterly crush them. In this crisis, other underground martial art warriors gather to fight by Baki's side: Kaoru Hanayama, Gouki Shibukawa, Retsu Kaioh, and Doppo Orochi. An epic showdown between violent death row inmates and Baki and his friends begins!

(Source: Netflix)

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Judo
tags.description: Centers around the sport of judo.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Boxing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of boxing.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Circus
tags.description: Prominently features a circus.

node.description:
[official site](http://devil-no-id.com/)

[twitter](https://twitter.com/DEVILNOID)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".

Website | Twitter | Facebook | Artist page (lantis) Introduction Granrodeo (stylized as GRANRODEO, and also known as KISHOW x e-Zuka) is a Japanese rock band, specializing in creating anime soundtracks. They are currently under the record label Lantis (2005-2009, 2012-), while previously having been under GloryHeaven (2009-2012) Biography In 2005 voice actor Kishō Taniyama ("Kishow") and musician Masaaki Iizuka ("E-Zuka"), known for his collaborations in creating anime soundtracks, decided to create a new project. During their years as a band, they released a few singles that were used as opening singles for the anime series. In 2007 they released their first album, Ride on the Edge, and in 2008 they release a second album, Instinct. In spring 2009 they started working on the soundtrack, the series Needless, for which E-Zuka wrote the soundtracks and Kishow wrote the lyrics for the song "Modern Strange Cowboy". By the end of 2009, they released their third album, Brush the Scar Lemon. In 2011 they released their fourth album, Supernova, and in 2012 they released their fifth album Crack Star Flash. Granrodeo covered "Tell Me" for the June 6, 2018 hide tribute album Tribute Impulse. Members Kishou Taniyama (谷山紀章/Kishow) - vocals, lyrics. (2005-) According to him, the role of a vocalist is more suitable for him than the role of a voice actor. Masaaki Iizuka (飯塚昌明/E-Zuka) - Guitar, composer, arranging. (2005-) His style of playing the guitar combines melodic solo parts and aggressive guitar riffs. He also collaborates with Minami Kuribayashi. (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

name.first: Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas
name.native: フィアー·アンド·ロージング·イン·ラスベガス

node.description:
[Website](http://www.lasvegas-jp.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Falilv) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/Falilv_Official/)

__Biography__
The band formed in 2008 in Kobe, Japan. Fear, and Loathing in Las Vegas combines electronica and metalcore, further exploring a number of influences from other genres among their discography. The singing is comprised of twin vocals; the destructive shouts of one vocalist contrasts with the autotune of the other, which gives them a presence like no other. In November 2009, their first EP "Burn the Disco Floor with Your 2-step!!" was released.

__Members__
- So - vocal, scream vocal, programming (joined in 2009)
- Minami - vocal, scream vocal, keyboard, programming
- Taiki - guitar, chorus, vocal
- Tomonori - drums
- Tetsuya - bass, chorus, vocal (joined in 2019)

__Former Members__
- Mashu - bass (left on September 21, 2013)
- Sxun - guitar, chorus, vocal (left on June 30, 2018)
- Kei - bass, chorus, vocal (died on January 12, 2019)

[Profile](www.horipro-international.com/artist/musician/tadokoro) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/azusa-tadokoro) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AzusaTadokoro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/azusa_tadokoro/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tadokoroazusaofficial)

She was a member in the tennis club at her middle and high schools, and she was also the general manager of the club in high school. When Azusa was in 8th grade, she was inspired to become a voice actress after hearing the Akiko Yajima's performance as Kohaku in Inuyasha. She participated in Horipro's 36th Talent Scout Caravan on October 11, 2011, was awarded as the grand prix winner and made her debut as a voice actress in 2012. In 2014, she made her official debut as a singer with the album "Beyond Myself!".

Azusa's hobbies including karaoke, impersonating, making albums, cooking and sewing. Her special skills include tennis - which she has been playing ever since fifth grade of elementary school - and arm wrestling, and she likes to stay healthy. She also loves both cows and movies, and has said that her ideal date would be either tennis or a movie so that she wouldn’t have to talk a lot. Azusa has four older brothers, and she went to the same high school as [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/Megumi-Nakajima)

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

[Profile](http://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/member.php?mem=m33) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kishownstarmaps)

He is also the vocalist and lyricist of the Japanese rock band [GRANRODEO](https://anilist.co/staff/103917/).

**Non anime roles:**
- [Panpanman](https://anilist.co/character/344471/PanPanMan) - YanOta: The Delinquent and the Otaku (Drama CD)

__Birthplace:__ Toukamachi, Niigata Prefecture, Japan __Masaaki Iizuka__ is a Japanese guitarist, arranger and composer. He graduated from the Muse-Mode (ミューズ・モード) Academy of Music and has worked on many anime song productions. He is currently a member of the band GRANRODEO along with Kishou Taniyama (also known as KISHOW).

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/renanlon) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RenanAlonsoDub) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/renanlon) | [Youtube 1](https://www.youtube.com/@Renan_Alonso) | [Youtube 2](https://www.youtube.com/@falafaladubdub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@renanlon)

Renan Alonso is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, musical director, musician, and podcaster. He is married to the voice actress [Bruna Nogueira](https://anilist.co/staff/176954/) and son of [Gilberto de Syllos](https://anilist.co/staff/258936/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Mortimer "Morty" Smith (Rick and Morty franchise and MultiVersus)
- Yoru (Valorant)
- Adrian "Alucard" Tepes (Castlevania and Castlevania: Nocturne)
- Percival de Rolo III (The Legend of Vox Machina)
- Cole Johnson (The Babysitter and The Babysitter: Killer Queen)
- H.U.E. (Final Space)
- Seo Hyun-Woo / Renan (Iris II: New Generation)
- Louis / Kang Ji-Sung (Shopping King Louie)
- Il-Sik (Mr. Sunshine)
- Eduard Zonte (Maggie & Bianca Fashion Friends)
- Happy (Happy!)
- Dirk Gently (Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency)
- Joel Maisel (The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel)
- Ace Spade (Heels)
- Bumblebee (Transformers: Cyberverse)
- Spike Barker (Go, Dog. Go!)
- Min-Gi Park, The Conductor, Cross-Eyed Ducks, Alrick Timmens, Roy and Brando / Zoobee (Infinity Train)
!~
Married to [Narumi Kakinouchi](https://anilist.co/staff/97378).

Keisuke Itagaki is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known for his martial arts series [Grappler Baki](https://anilist.co/manga/41425/Grappler-Baki/) (1991–1999) and its five sequels, which have sold over 100 million volumes. In 1996, he began working on [Garouden](https://anilist.co/manga/37921/Garouden/), an original work by [Baku Yumemakura](https://anilist.co/staff/97026/Baku-Yumemakura). He has also collaborated on the series [Garouden Boy](https://anilist.co/manga/45998/Garouden-Boy/).

Prior to becoming a manga artist, he served 5 years in the 1st Airborne Brigade of the Japan Ground Self-Defense Force. During his service, he practiced amateur boxing and has competed in the National Sports Festival. He also holds a degree in Shorinji Kempo, which he has practiced since he was a teenager. 

He is the father of the famous mangaka [Paru Itagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/121564/).
Originating from Anime Toro Toro.
Noriko Ooishi is a background artist.
Noriko Ooishi is a background artist.
